Articles.Content: I can't find 0.22, is it currently a pre-release? Or is it late to update for steam?
It's not out yet.
The media team got a test pre-release to show and explain it. Keep in mind that the version they got is different from the one we'll get, because it's still in experimentals.
Take it easy. not released yet
Oh, just wondering because I Saw one of danny2462 the rocket master's videos of a first time in 0.22
He's part of the media team. His job is to do that.
I know what you mean, i saw HOC gamings video and was sad after I realized when it wasn't out
Its not out (as stated many times above). An article will be posted when it is released, along with the servers being fried.
At least what will be left of the servers after download day. It'll be like Windows update Tuesday, 8-10kb/s for 10+ hours.

At least what will be left of the servers after download day. It'll be like Windows update Tuesday, 8-10kb/s for 10+ hours.

Or it'll be like 0.20 release day, which was effectively the same thing
You'll know it's out when a KerbalSpaceProgram post hits the front page of reddit.
Patchteased again! Grraaaagh!
Everytime there is an update there is always that one person like the OP who thinks they didn't get it when only the media team got it.

You'll know its out when:

1. There is an article posted titled ".22 update released!" (It should look just like that)

2. People will be posting all about it on the "Show off your awesome KSP pictures" thread

3a. Most obviously, every time you change pages on the forum it will take 3 hours to load and half the time will result in a failed connection.

3b. Some symptoms of the above include, but aren't limited to increased double posting, llllaaaaggg, and servers pooping out due to overload.

Everytime there is an update there is always that one person like the OP who thinks they didn't get it when only the media team got it.

More like, those ten people

Give then a little break. English is not all of our first languages. People see 0.22 vids appearing youtube, don't necessarily understand the closed-beta-of-the-alfa concept (odd for an indi game) and start looking. Add to this all the debate/discussion of the new features on the forum and anyone could think that the new version is already out and being played.

Edited October 14, 2013 by Sandworm

and anyone could think that the new version is already out and being played.

Don't forget there's a multitude of threads asking if it's out. A little research before posting yet another thread asking the same question would be nice.
There is a rule that everyone who asks about the update gets it a week later for every time they ask. Ive been playing it the last couple of days and its great.
well good for you I guess

There is a rule that everyone who asks about the update gets it a week later for every time they ask. Ive been playing it the last couple of days and its great.

Actually, should I not be mistaken, each update gets delayed by a day when someone asks, not every week.

Even so, at this rate, we'll never get 0.22 until 2014!

LOL, guys, I know that feeling, trust me, I went through this about 3 times. And I can guarantee (But don't quote me on it) that as long as there's no problems with development, it'll be out before November.

LOL, I know that feeling, trust me, I went through this about 3 times. And I can guarantee (But don't quote me on it) that as long as there's no problems with development, it'll be out before November.

we can hope this is the case, but, I am not holding my breath for it to be by months end. By years end? probably
media test gets the beta >> a couple months >> release

Lol.......

Edited October 15, 2013 by spikeyhat09

media test gets the beta >> a couple months >> release

couple months? for 0.21 i think the release was like 4-5 days after the marathon on ksptv, nah i think it'll show by the end of october, but then again, that's if no big ass bug comes up
